W-Br : Hi, Ricardo. l'm going to go to the data analysis workshop this weekend—what about you? Mr. Yun and the other managers sent us an e-mail encouraging US to go for the extra professional development.
M-Cn : Well, I checked out the program, and it looks interesting. The only thing is the registration fee. I don't think I can afford it.
W-Br : We can get reimbursed. Mr. Yun said the company would pay for training as long as we submit a report of what we learned. Why don't you talk to him about it?
M-Cn : Oh, that's right. I'll go see him this afternoon.

M-Au : Ms. Samara, welcomel My name's Oscar, and l'll be taking you on a tour of our candle factory today. We're so happy that you're writing an article about our fragrant candles for your magazine.
W-An : Thanks, Oscar! Our readers know how important scent is to making a home feel comfortable. This article about your creation process will be very popular. I'd especially like to see the new sandalwood candles you're working on.
M-Au : I’m sorry. l can tell you about our marketing plans for that line, but because of privacy concerns, the new-product- development area won't be part of the tour. I hope you understand.

W-Br : Well, all of my sales reports are due today.

W- Br : Welcome to Principle Chartered Bank. How can I help you?
M-Au : Hi. I'm applying for a small-business loan with your bank. I have the application documents here, but l was hoping someone could explain to me how to fill out a section of the personal financial statement. For my income, should I include any investments that I own as a source of income?
W- Br : Yes, you should include income from any investments on Line 2. Let's see, other than that I think your application looks good. Oh, but do you have a copy of your business plan? It’s very important that you include that.
M-Au : Right. I have my business plan in my briefcase. Thanks for checking.

M-Au : Fiona, Klaus, thanks for meeting with me. You know we're going to start using a new software system for scheduling customer orders. The new program should really improve our factory's efficiency. And...uh... we've decided to start using the software next week.
W-Br : Really? But that means we have to learn the new system as we manage customer orders. l'm worried we won't be able to handle both tasks at the same time.
M-Au : I understand. But the software company is providing US with an on-site coordinator. His name is Mario Jones. He'll help US transition to the new software.
M-Cn : OK, good. Does he know our old system, too?
M-Au : Yes, that's the best part. Mario has experience with both programs, so things should go smoothly.

Transcript:
M-Au OK, let’s get the monthly staff meeting started. First off, this Saturday is the annual holiday parade. And as many of you know, the parade goes right down our street. It’s always one of our busiest days... lots of people will stop by for lunch, and the line can get quite long. So we’ll need a few extra cooks and servers, and everyone who works that day'll get overtime pay. Let me know soon if you are able to work on Saturday. Oh... and I strongly recommend taking the bus or train if you can. Remember that it’ll be very difficult to park on Saturday during the event.

M-Cn Hi, Jamie. I really like the suggestion you gave at yesterday's staff meeting for promoting our electronics store. I think holding a photography contest is a great idea, especially since we mainly sell cameras and camera equipment. There are several things we’d have to do to prepare for it, though, like decide on a submission deadline and outline the basic rules for the contest. We could even consider offering a prize for the first-place winner. Let’s meet sometime this week to get started. I’ll take a look at our schedules this morning and book a time for us to get together.

Transcript:
W-Br OK everyone, before you head out to the factory floor this morning to start your shifts, I have a brief announcement. As most of you know, the new conveyor belt is now installed and up and running. This new conveyor belt is very similar to the older model, except it’s twice as fast as the old one. This means that our factory can now move double the number of units per hour. Clearly, this is a big improvement in production speed. However, it could also be a challenge for us to watch out for production errors. So,you’re all required to watch a short training video this morning before starting work.

Transcript:
M-Au Do you work in the technology industry? Want to stay updated on the latest industry trends? Subscribe to our online magazine, Tech Now. This month’s issue is devoted to women who are leaders in the technology field. We’re pleased to present an exclusive interview with Erika Cliffton, the founder and CEO of Cliffton Technology Solutions. Erika gives advice for women starting their own businesses and shares her personal success story. If you subscribe to Tech Now today, you’ll receive a free padded carrying case for your laptop. But hurry - the promotion expires in a week!

Transcript:
W-Am This is Health on the Go, a weekly broadcast that gives you advice about your eating habits. Today we’re talking about salt, Who’s heard that salt is not good for you? Well... this negative view of salt is surprising because it’s simply not true. You actually do need some salt in your diet to remain healthy. But remember— salt occurs naturally in most foods, so you don't need to add extra salt to your diet. In fact, even fruits and vegetables contain salt. I know you’re all interested in trying more recipes that use fruits and vegetables. Well be talking about that on next week's broadcast.

And... at the top of our list is an exciting announcement from Francisco City—where a solar-powered airport will be built! One of the very first solar-powered airports in the world! If you’re looking for a job, Nassar Builders, the construction firm that is building the airport, will be holding an employment fair next month. At the fair, they'll interview and hire workers for the project. For more details about Nassar Builders, check the city’s Web site.

M-Cn: Hi, everyone. My name is Raul Bautista and this is History with Raul, the weekly podcast where we investigate little-known historical facts that have had a huge impact on today's world. Today we’ll be discussing a topic from art history. Well hear about the mysterious disappearance of some paintings from a museum in seventeenth-century Europe. Professor Ignacio Ortega from Westland University will explain what happened. But before we speak to Professor Ortega — please remember, this program is only made possible by the financial support of our members. Visit historywithraul. org today.

Transcript:
M-Au Thanks for attending this planning meeting for the new neighborhood garden. I’m Chao, and I’m coordinating this project. Here’s the layout for the new garden. We'll mostly be planting vegetables, but we will have a herb garden, too, and we’re going to plant that first. The herbs are going to go in the plot between the picnic area and the toolshed. Also, I need volunteers to help me on Saturday. I’d like to put up a fence around the perimeter of the garden. The wood for the fence will be delivered that morning.

question.text: Who is the speaker?
Look at the graphic. Where will herbs be planted?
What does the speaker plan to do on Saturday?
Mr. Ashburton has been _____ recommended by all three of his references.

answer.explanation: Before the blank to fill is a verb auxiliary, after the blank to be filled is the main verb so the word to be filled is an ADV (adverb)

question.text: Mr. Choi wants to know when the illustrations will be ready for  _____ review.

answer.explanation: Before the blank is for, after the blank is review, a noun should be filled with possessive adjectives.

question.text: The project meeting has been rescheduled   _____  tomorrow because of the bad weather.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> D

question.text: Smooth Tek’s newest software makes it much  _____ for business owners to create newsletters.

answer.explanation: Before the blank is "much", often use "much" in comparison  before the adjective to emphasize

question.text: By  _____ offices in London, Paris, and Madrid, Sedgehill Ltd. has continued its growth into markets overseas.

answer.explanation:
Before the place to fill is a preposition, then a noun => need to fill V-ing.
By + V-ing + N

question.text: _____ the kiln’s heat is set too high, the ceramic objects inside may be ruined.

answer.explanation:
The first clause is in the present tense, the second one uses "may" + Verb, so this is a conditional sentence.
Then, based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer => B

question.text: The National Overview is the fourth  ______ distributed newspaper in the northeastern region.

answer.explanation: After the blank is distributed (adjective), before that is "the", so the space to fill should be an adverb and in the superlative form.

question.text: Dr. Lin, the keynote speaker at this years Southeast Dentistry Convention, _____ several groundbreaking dental devices.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: Rose's Bistro will close next month due to escalating operating  _____.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: During yesterday's meeting, Ms. Milne offered her  _____ to the sales team for their excellent results this quarter.

answer.explanation: Before the blank is the adjective, after the blank is the preposition so need to fill in a noun

question.text: The employee satisfaction survey results are  _____ to differ among departments.

answer.explanation: Struture:  likely to V

question.text: The course taught by Prof. Brennink is intended for  _____ interested in medical or health-related careers.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>B

question.text: Starting September 1, the accounting department will issue travel reimbursements  _____ from biweekly paychecks.

answer.explanation: Before the blank, there is a full structure, there is the verb "will issue" and the noun of the plural "travel reimbursements" so the blank needs to be filled in Adv.

question.text: The planned construction of several new office buildings in Newb니ry has created a  demand for skilled workers.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>C

question.text: The new computer security program allows  users to  _____  any suspicious activity on their account.

answer.explanation: Structure: allows sb to V sth

question.text: The  _____ of the Kawagoe factory has had a significant impact on Inagi Technology employees’ productivity.

answer.explanation: After the blank is "the", after the blank is "of" so need to fill a noun

question.text: Please review the repair estimate carefully _____  it has been received from the maintenance department.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>D

question.text: _____  of the marketing assistant include coordinating focus groups and writing detailed reports.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> D

question.text: The product development team for Herbeve Cosmetics is  _____ a package redesign to try to increase sales.

answer.explanation:
Before the blank is "is", after the blank is phase "a package redesign".
=> need to fill V-ing/ be V-ing

question.text: _____ an increase in small, individual furnaces, glassblowing has become a more accessible and popular art medium.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: Our  investment in solar energy was a key   _____  in achieving energy independence.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: Payments made to your account after the invoice was generated are not  _____ in the balance shown.

answer.explanation: The subject is payments, and before a preposition so this place needs to fill in a passive verb.

question.text: See our media kit for facts and information   _____ our line of lighting equipment.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> B

question.text: The lawyers report that the merger was successfully concluded  _____ last-minute negotiations.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>C

question.text: Mr. Hong will outline the procedures for handling customers’  _____  information.

answer.explanation: Before the blank is possessive, after that is the noun, so before information needs an adjective

question.text: You are invited to Wilson Associates' third annual company picnic. The event ---1---- to take place on June 12 from 12:30 P.M. to 4:30 P.M. at Baker Field. 2.------- should consider contributing an item to be used during the sports activities. This donation can be for croquet, badminton, lawn bowling, or a similar type of activity. In addition to games, you can enjoy delicious food throughout the afternoon. 3-------. Please notify a manager if you have any special dietary needs 4.------- we can accommodate you.  We look forward to seeing you on June 12!

answer.explanation: The place to fill is missing the verb. The passage is about an upcoming party so the verb here is simple and the subject is "event" so the verb "schedule" will be passive.
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer. In the answers only A is reasonable.

choices: (A) Volunteers should report to the venue at noon.
(B) All the food will be supplied by Tambara Caterers.
(C) Wilson Associates donates to charities annually.
(D) Thanks for responding to the invitation so quickly.

answer.text: (B) All the food will be supplied by Tambara Caterers.
answer.explanation: Notice that the previous sentence mentions "you can enjoy delicious food" and the following sentence says "special dietary needs". Therefore, the sentence to be filled will also relate to "food".
Based on the meaning of the words to select the appropriate answer

question.text:
To: All Staff
From: Fiona Norton, President
Re: Adelaide branch
Date: 2 May

To All Staff,
I am thrilled to announce that because of increased demand for our services, Farley Norton Insurance will be opening a second branch in Adelaide on 1 September. 139.-------.

We are looking to fill a number of vacancies in Adelaide. The jobs section of our Web page, www.farleynorton.com.au, will be updated as positions 140.------- and are filled. Staff members interested in relocating 141.------- Human Resources Manager Geri Thompson-Howe. Those approved for relocation will begin their roles in the new branch on 25 August.

We look forward to this new 142.------- in our company's future.

Thank you,
Fiona

choices: (A) Geri Thompson-Howe can answer questions about moving costs.
(B) Some of the positions include office manager and assistant manager.
(C) Web site administrator Ashton Lee should be congratulated on a job well done.
(D) Louis Farley will be heading this new branch.

answer.text: (D) Louis Farley will be heading this new branch.
answer.explanation: Because the preceding sentence mentions the opening of a new branch, the missing sentence will also be related to this. In the answers given, there is D is appropriate.
Vocabulary questions. Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer.

Can be seen in the sentence without adverbs of time and with the context of this paragraph, using the past tense here is unreasonable so the answers A, B and D. are excluded. Moreover, the sentence is suggestive, the introduction should choose answer C which is completely appropriate.

question.text:
To Jettizon Printing Clients:

Last April, Jettizon management determined that it was necessary to migrate to a new e-mail system. The Jettizon team completed the transition yesterday. The decision 143.------- to upgrade this week to avoid disruption during our busy winter season.
We expect that this change will be barely 144.------- to our clients. There may, however, be minor delays in response times 145.------- our employees become familiar with the new system. 146.-------. Please do not hesitate to contact your Jettizon account representative with any questions or concerns. Thank you for your understanding.

answer.explanation: The previous sentences in the paragraph mention the transition to a new e-mail system and this was done yesterday. Therefore, a "decision" has been made in the past. The verb will be conjugated in the past tense so the answer is D.
Questions about vocabulary. Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer.
Based on the meaning to select the appropriate answer. Answer B. as = when

choices: (A)  This is recommended for established clients.
(B) The team deserves to be congratulated for this achievement.
(C) We appreciate your patience in the coming days.
(D) Take a few minutes to review the new procedures.

answer.text: (C) We appreciate your patience in the coming days.
answer.explanation: In this context, when the previous sentences mention that there will be "delays", answer C refers to "patience".

Must have valid driver’s license. Send resume to lblock@saganaw.com by June. No phone calls please. Qualified candidates will be contacted.

question.text:
Questions 151-152 refer to the following text-message chain.

Arthur Chun (8:31 A.M.)
Can you give me a hand? I can't get the projector to work in the conference room.
Hannah Lind (8:31 A.M.)
Sure. What's the problem?
Arthur Chun (8:32 A.M.)
No idea. I keep getting an error message when I press the power button.
Hannah Linh (8:33 A.M.)
Are the cables connected?
Arthur Chun (8:33 A.M.)
Yes. Would you be able to come over here? My presentation starts soon!
Hannah Lind (8:34 A.M.)
It's probably just setting. I can show you. Give me a minute to get there.
At 8:32 A.M, what does the Mr. Chun most likely mean when he writes "No idea"?
choices: (A)He does not know when the event begins.
(B)He does not know whether the cables are connected.
(C)He does not know where to deliver a message.
(D)He does not know why the equipment is not working.

answer.text: (D)He does not know why the equipment is not working.
answer.explanation: When Hannah Lind asked Arthur Chun "What's the problem", he replied 'No idea', it meant he didn't know the problem. What is the problem with the projector, why is it not working.

question.text: What will Ms. Lind mostly do next?

answer.explanation: At the end of the message, Lind says to Chun "Give me a minute to get there" (Give me a minute to get there). So that means she's going to the conference room.

question.text:
Question 153-155 refer to the following notice.

Critically acclaimed poet and Northlander University professor Jeremiah Hines will give a poetry reading at the Cafe Metropolitan on Friday, June 16, form 7:00 P.M. to 8:30 P.M. Dr. Hines will preview five poems from his latest collection, Book, to be published in August by Northlander University Press.

In addition to Dr. Hines, several of his creative-writing students will also read their work. They include Annabelle Rothman, Michard Lefevre, and Dina Fernandez. All have had one or more poems published in the most recent issue of Northlander Fiction Today.

Two additional spots have been reserved for members of the public to read their own poetry. If you would like to be considered, e-mail one original poem (250 words or less) to Alicia Wilson at awilson@cafemetropolitan.org before 5:00 P.M on June 1.

Tickets to the poetry reading are $10 and can be purchased at the Cafe Metropolitan or through its Web site.
www.cafemetropolitan.biz                                                     Cafe Metropolitan
(520) 555-0177
What is the purpose of the notice?

answer.explanation: The notice provides information about the upcoming poetry reading session at Café Metropolitan including participants, timing, and ticket prices. So the correct answer is B.

question.text: Who is Mr. Lefevre?

answer.explanation: The information for this sentence is “… several of his creative-writing students will also read their work. They include Annabelle Rothman, Michard Lefevre, and Dina Fernandez. ”

question.text: What are members of the public invited to do?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence “If you would like to be considered, e-mail one original poem (250 words or less) to Alicia Wilson at awilson@cafemetropolitan.org before 5:00 PM on June 1. " (If you want to be considered, email an original poem

question.text:
Questions 156 – 158 refer to the following Web page.

Our goal here at Really Real is to help the people of New Zealand make informed decisions about their planned purchases. --- [1] ---. This service features honest and unbiased customer reviews of products available on the market. These products are currently limited to electronics and appliances. --- [2] ---.

We are a nonprofit service. We are not an online store, and we do not sell any of the products that are rated on our site. If you set up an account, you are welcome to share your own experience about your recent purchases. --- [3] ---. To register for an account, simply type your e-mail address in the box provided on our home page. We promise that you will not receive any e-mail promotions form us. Many manufacturers use our free service to gain insight into customer trends, by sharing your views, you will be helping companies develop better offerings. --- [4] ---.
What is mentioned about Really Real?

answer.explanation: The information is in the sentence "We promise that you will not receive any e-mail promotions form us." (We promise that you will not receive any promotional emails.). So the correct answer is C

question.text: What does Really Real's service allow companies to do?

answer.explanation: Information lies in place “Many manufacturers use our free service to gain insight into customer trends, by sharing your views, you will be helping companies develop better offerings.” (Many manufacturers use our free service to get insight into consumer trends, by sharing views, you are helping companies develop better products.) Thus, companies can use Really Real's services to get customers' perspectives, thereby improving products for better.

question.text: In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?“Beginning in January, we plan to include furniture as well."

answer.explanation: You can see the sentence just ahead that says "These products are currently limited to electronics and appliances." (These products are currently limited to electronics and devices). So entering a given sentence in position [2] is perfectly reasonable because it tells about the plans of all types to be available on Really Real in the future, following the previous sentence about the present.

question.text:
Caivano Printing Services
Level 4, 468 Wickham Street
Sydney NSW 2001
Work Order Form
Date of order:        20September   
Employee Name:   Amelia Cates  
Date of pickup:        1 October, between 2 P.M. and 3 P.M. 
 
Customer Information:
Name: JohannaGarza           
Organisation: Sydney Medical Research Forum  
Phone:55559823                 
Instructions:
The customer sent the graphic electronically; see e-mail of 20 September with subject line “Garza order.” She asked for the image to be enlarged enough that all words and numbers can be seen clearly from about 3 metres away.
 
Print:
Four standard medium posters
 
Special notes:
The customer needs these items for a conference on 2 October, so she stressed that they absolutely must be ready on time. She paid in full on 20 September with her organisation’s credit card.
What did Ms. Garza ask Caivano Printing Services to do?
choices: (A)Call her when an order is ready
(B)Use certain colors in a printing job
(C)Ensure that text is visible from a distance
(D)Reprint posters to correct a mistake that was made

answer.text: (C)Ensure that text is visible from a distance
answer.explanation: In the Instructions section it said “She asked for the image to be enlarged enough that all words and numbers can be seen clearly from about 3 meters away.” (She asked for the image to be enlarged enough so that letters and numbers can be seen clearly from a distance of 3m) So the correct answer to this sentence is C.

question.text: What is true about the posters?
choices: (B)Ms. Garza still owes money from them.
(C)Each conference participant will receive one of them.
(D)Ms. Garza will pick them up the day before a conference.

answer.text: (D)Ms. Garza will pick them up the day before a conference.
answer.explanation: According to information from the order form, Ms. Garza will pick it up on October 1st and the conference will take place on October 2nd. So the correct answer is D

question.text:
Question 161-163 refer to the following Web page.

Young Roboticist Canada
Young Roboticist Canada lets kids experience the exciting world of robotic! Our courses motivate young learners through hands-on experiences constructing robots in laboratory settings. We offer a wide variety of options for children ages 7-15, including after-school and Saturday courses as well as summer camps.
The courses at Young Roboticists Canada are created by top-rated professors and professional roboticists around the world. Visit the Instructions page to learn more about their research. In addition, many of our participants have received scholarships to study computer science at prestigious universities and have gone on to work for top companies.
Registering your child is easy. High-level courses build on information learned in all introductory courses, so read the course descriptions to ensure that your child meets all prerequisites. Then select the course that fits your child's interests and complete the online form. Seats fill up quickly, so be sure to register at least one month before the course begins.
What is NOT indicated about Young Roboticists Canada?
choices: (B)It teaches children how to build robots.
(D)It gives young students the chance to work in a laboratory.

answer.explanation:
By the exclusion method, it can be seen that only information of option C is not covered in the article.
-Project A: “many of our participants have received scholarships to study computer science at universities” (many participants have received scholarships to study computer science at prestigious universities)
-Option B: “Our courses motivate young learners through hands-on experiences constructing robots” (Our course motivates young learners to experience robot building)
-Project D: “Constructing robots in laboratory settings”
Only information in option C is not discussed. So the answer to this question is C.

question.text: What is mentioned about the instructors?

answer.explanation: In the article, "Visit the Instructions page to learn more about their research." (Visit the guide page to learn more about their studies). As such, professors and instructors here are involved in the research.

question.text: What are parents asked to do?

answer.explanation: Obviously only option B is mentioned. Information in “so read the course descriptions to ensure that your child meets all prerequisites” (so read the course descriptions to ensure that your child meets all prerequisites)

question.text:
Questions 164-167 refer to the following online chat discussion.

Bradley Sento [11:14 A.M.]: Hi, Cheng and Zara. We've finished painting the of the office walls. We'll be installing the blinds next. We need your decision on the tile pattern for the restroom floor.
Cheng Han [11:15 A.M]: Hi Bradley. Zara's on the phone right now. Night be a while. Will you get back to you.
Bradley Sento: [11:15 A.M.]: OK.
Cheng Han [11:17 A.M]: Never mind. That call took less time than I expected. Give us a few minutes to decide.
Breadley Sento [11:18 A.M.]: Take your time.
Zara Charbel [11:23 A.M.]: Hi Bradley. We'll go with the Roman mosaic floor tiles.
Bradley Sento:[11:24 A.M.]: Great choice. I can have them here sometime tomorrow.
Zara Charbel: [11:25 A.M.]: And I forgot to mention that the carpet installation has also been completed.
Cheng Han[11:26 A.M]: Good to know. I will call Ideafinity and have them deliver the furniture.
Bradley Sento: [11:27 A.M.]: OK. Let me know the delivery time so I can make space for the furniture van. About the budget, I'll check with my flooring contractor. I'll have an answer for you by the end of the day.
Zara Charbel [11:29 A.M.]: OK, thanks.
Cheng Han [11:30 A.M.]:  And thanks for transforming a traditional office into a modern one.
What information does Mr. Sento ask for?

answer.explanation: Information at Mr. Sento's first message “We need your decision on the tile pattern for the restroom floor.

question.text: At 11:17 A:M, what does Mr. Han most likely mean when he writes, "Never mind"?
choices: (A)He is not concerned with the estimated cost.
(B)He has changed his mind about the color choice.
(C)Ms. Charbel is no longer talking on the phone.
(D)Mr. Sento does not need to install the blinds.

answer.text: (C)Ms. Charbel is no longer talking on the phone.
answer.explanation: Mr. Han said “Never mind” and then continued saying that Charbel's phone call wasn't as long as he thought. So that meant Mr. Han told Mr. Sento not to notice Miss Charbel's calling because she was done.

question.text: What is a promise Mr. Sento made to Ms. Charbel?
choices: (A)He will obtain some information for her.
(B)He will put her in touch with his flooring contractor.
(C)He will complete the work by the end of the week.
(D)He will take the furniture out of a delivery truck.

answer.text: (A)He will obtain some information for her.
answer.explanation: At 11; 27 AM, Mr. Sento had the message “About the budget, I'll check with my flooring contractor. I'll have an answer for you by the end of the day. ” (Regarding the budget, I will check with the floor contractor. I will have the answer for you at the end of the day.) So that means Mr. Sento will provide the budget information from the contractor to Miss Charbel.

question.text: Why most likely is the work being done?
choices: (B)An office space is going to be sold.
(C)A business wanted to update its work space.
(D)A property owner needed to remove some damaged materials.

answer.text: (C)A business wanted to update its work space.
answer.explanation: Can be inferred from the last line of the message "thanks for transforming a traditional office into a modern one" (thanks for making a traditional office modern.) This business is looking to renovate office space.

Transcript:
M-Cn: What should employees bring to training session?
M-Au:
(A) Just a pencil and some paper.
(B) Not if it's busy.
(C) Early in the morning.

question.text:
Questions 168-171 refer to the following article.

Candy-Selling Youth Finds Wallet
         THURMONT (April 22) –  On Tuesday a wallet containing a sizable amount of money was discovered in Thurmont by 13-year-old Tim Suderman. That morning, Tim was out selling candy bars door-to-door to earn money for the new uniforms needed by his middle school football team. “I was on the sidewalk along Fount Street when I noticed a wallet just sitting there,” Tim recounts. According to Tim, the wallet contained several large bills, two credit cards, and a family picture. The name on the credit cards was William Bradlin, but there was nothing in the wallet that provided an address.
        Wanting to return the wallet to Mr. Bradlin as soon as possible, Tim walked to nearby Forest View Market to see if anyone could help him with his search.
        “The first clerk I talked to immediately recognize Mr. Bradlin was the owner of Thurmont Bicycles, just around the corner from the market.”
         The clerk made a quick phone call the Mr. Bradlin, who rushed over to Forest View Market.
         “I must have lost my wallet walking from the market back to work.: sad Mr. Bradlin, who was delighted with the return of his lost property. He was so pleased that he opened up his wallet and bought all 20 candy bars that Tim had for sale. And he gave him an extra $50 to further boost the uniform fund.
  “A good deed like that deserves a reward!” add Mr. Bradlin.
What is indicated about Tim?
choices: (A)He wants to work at a bicycle shop.
(B)He is a member of a sports team.

answer.text: (B)He is a member of a sports team.
answer.explanation:
From the text of the article, it can be seen that only the information in option B is correct.
”Tim was out selling candy bars door-to-door to earn money for the new uniforms needed by his middle school football team.” (Tim goes out to sell candy bars door to door to earn money for the uniforms needed by the high school soccer team). Tim needs money to buy uniforms for the soccer team, so he's a member of the team.

question.text: What was NOT included in the wallet?

answer.explanation: By the exclusion method, only "driver license" is not included in the lesson.

question.text: What did Tim receive as a reward?

answer.explanation: Information located on the sentence “And he gave him an extra $ 50 to further boost the uniform fund.” (And he gave you another 50 dollars to raise the uniform fund.) So Mr. Bradlin donated $ 50 to Tim's uniform fund.

question.text: The word "deed" in paragraph 6, line 1, is closest meaning to

answer.explanation: This is a question about vocabulary, based on the meaning to choose the correct answer. The word "deed" means "work, action", so the correct answer to this sentence is A.

What most likely is Mr. Ruzinski?

answer.explanation: According to the content of the email, Ruzinski is asked to replace a member of a team that is handling the finance of the Gartera store. Therefore, Ruzinski has to do in this field as well. Of all the answers given, answer B is the most suitable.

question.text: What has Ms. Alves requested?

answer.explanation: Information contained in the sentence “I have notified your team leader, Hyun Shik, who agreed to let me borrow you for a few days” (I informed your team leader, Hyun Shil, who had agreed to let me borrow you for a few days.) With that, Ms. Alves asked Ruzinski's team leader to reassign his staff, and take Ruzinski to her team for a few days.

question.text: Why does Ms. Alves offer to meet with Mr. Ruzinski?
choices: (C)To plan the hiring of new employees

answer.explanation: Information on “I would be happy to meet with you to show you how to use the software to meet those tasks”

question.text: In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?

answer.explanation: The sentence before the required position should appear a noun indicating the person equivalent to "he" in a given sentence. So, in the empty positions, we can see that only [3] can satisfy.

question.text:
Question 176-180 refer to the following Website and e-mail.



-----------------------------------------
-----------------------------------------
To: cplum@homemail.co.uk
From:donations@giveandtakebooks.co.uk
Date: 22 July
Subject: Re: Donation

Hello Mr. Plum,
Thank you very much for your offer to donate 100 books to our shop! 1 would he happy to arrange to have the books picked up at your home. For such a large number of books, we are happy to go the extra distance. To expedite the pickup process, please Slack the books by genre to the best of your ability. Our driver will pack the books into boxes for you.
Our next available appointment for pickup is this Tuesday, 25 July, at 2 P.M. Let me know if this time works for you.

Thank you,

Tina Voss, Manager
Give-and-Take Bookstore
What is indicated about Give-and-Take Bookstore?
choices: (C)It is located next to Delford Park.
(D)It sells both new and used books.

answer.explanation: Information is in the sentence: “Remember, 10% of all proceeds from our book sales are donated to projects in the community” (Remember, 10% of all proceeds from book sales donations for projects in the community).

question.text: According to the Web site, what do book donors receive?

answer.explanation: Information can be found in the sentence: “All book donation will be rewarded with a merchandise credit”

question.text: In the e-mail, the word "arrange" in paragraph 1, line 2, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: This is a question about vocabulary. Need based on meaning to choose the correct answer. The word "arrange" means to arrange and in this case it has nothing special. So answer B is the most suitable.

question.text: What store policy was waived for Mr. Plum?
choices: (B)The genres of books that are accepted for donation
(C)The condition of books that are given to the store
(D)The minimum number of books that can be picked up

answer.explanation: In the email it says “For such a large number of books, we are happy to go the extra distance” (With such a large number of books, we happily travel further distances). Thus, the bookstore will have to go further than the stated distance on the website (within a radius of 10km from the store) to collect Mr. Plum's books.

question.text: In the e-mail, what is Mr. Plum asked to do?

answer.explanation: Information in there “To expedite the pickup process, please stack books by genre”

question.text:
Questions 181-185 refer to the following e-mail and survey.

To: Greta Myers - gmyers@wingstar.com.bm
From: Maurice Tolliver - mtolliver@bermudasciencemuseum.bm
Date: 25 June
Subject: Membership campaign
Attachment: 10 survey

Dear Ms. Myers,
The Bermuda Science Museum’s September membership campaign will soon begin. In order to serve our present members the best way we can and attract new members, we are asking for your feedback. We are interested in how we can best meet your needs and expectations and would like to know how you feel about the permanent and special museum exhibitions, our newly renovated cafes, and the parking area.

Perhaps you were one of the many visitors who enjoyed our special seafaring exhibition in April. Do you think any part of your experience visiting the replica of the eighteenth-century ship, the Betsy, could have been better? Please help US improve our museum and its programs by completing the attached survey.

Thank you, and 1 look forward to seeing you again at the museum.

Maurice Tolliver
Director of Museum Services
=====================
Who most likely is Ms. Myers?

answer.explanation: As can be seen, Ms. Myers is the one who received an email with a survey about her experience at the museum to better serve her members. As such, Ms. Myers is a member of this museum.

question.text: In the e-mail, the word "meet" in paragraph 1, line 3, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: The word "meet" in the phrase "meet the need" means "meet the need". So, in this case, "meet" is closest to the meaning of "satisfy"

question.text: What was recently improved at the museum?

answer.explanation: The last line of paragraph 1 of the email mentions “our newly renovated café”. The café is considered a dining establishment, so B is Correct answer.

question.text: What activity at the museum is Ms. Myers least likely to participate in?

answer.explanation: It can be seen that "attending lectures" is the lowest of all the options that Miss Myers has never done at the museum. So when you get back to the museum, this is what you are likely to do.

question.text: When did Ms. Myers visit the museum?

answer.explanation: The information is in the following sentence in the email: “Perhaps you were one of the many visitors who enjoyed our special seafaring exhibition in April” (Maybe you are one of the many visitors who enjoyed the trip exhibition. special sea in April) Thus, Ms. Myers visited the museum in April.

question.text: Questions 186-190 refer to the following brochure, e-mail, and policy statement.
What vehicle was Ms. Martinez unable to reserve?

answer.explanation:
According to an email message Ms. Martinez sent to Stellar Auto Rental, the customer service representative stated that “a car to 5 adults was unavailable” (not enough for 5 adults), That vehicle is the "Premium car".
As such, Ms. Martinez was unable to order a premium vehicle.

question.text: What is the purpose of the e-mail?

answer.explanation: In the email, Ms. Martinez stated that she canceled her reservation but was still charged $ 50 and wondered why she was charged. “I cancelled the reservation. Yesterday, however, I received my credit card statement and noticed I have been charge $ 50 by Stellar Auto Rental. Why am I being charged this amount? ”

question.text: In the e-mail, the word "Shortly" in paragraph 1, line 2 is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: This is a question about vocabulary, based on meaning to choose the correct answer. The word "shortly" means "shortly, soon, so it is closest to" soon "

question.text: What is probably true about Ms. Martinez?
choices: (A)She does not have a valid driver's license.
(B)She did not need to travel to Istabul.
(D)She wanted a colleague to drive the rental vehicle.

answer.explanation: Martinez's account was charged $ 50 by the car rental company. For rental terms and conditions, this fee is for contract cancellation made before the scheduled pick up date. Ms. Martinez booked the original rental schedule on August 27th, thus canceling the contract before this date.

question.text: What is indicated about Stellar Auto Rental?
choices: (A)It provides local maps at no additional cost.
(B)It charges $100 per week for auto insurance.
(C)It has a membership program for frequent customers.
(D)It requires a payment upon reservation of a vehicle.

answer.text: (D)It requires a payment upon reservation of a vehicle.
answer.explanation: Only information in option D as mentioned in the rental terms and conditions: “Payment must be made in full when the vehicle is reserved”

question.text:
Norview City Observer
To the Editor:
A poll conducted last week by the Centre for Civic Engagement has shown that 19 percent of respondents approve of the RIR. Critics of the IRI are most concerned that it will be paid for by raising local taxes. This will leave residents like me with less money for food, clothing, and toiletries, which, in turn, will mean less revenue for businesses in the area. It may also encourage high-income earners to leave Norview City or spend their disposable income elsewhere. Any gains made by higher taxation would be offset by corresponding losses. The city government should look into other options to fund the project.
................................................................
Happy Days for Norview City Council
 
(22 July) - This week brought some welcome news for the Norview City Council. Just a few months ago, the council's proposed Infrastructure Redevelopment Initiative seemed unlikely to succeed; a poll released on 14 April by the Centre for Civic Engagement (CCE) revealed that just 19 percent of respondents backed the plan, since then, the council has held a series of public hearings, and a number of adjustments have been made to the proposal.
A CCE poll released earlier this week shows that now 52 percent of respondents are willing to fund the programme by paying 0.5 percent more in taxes. Two more public hearings on the IRI have been scheduled.
The first will be held next Wednesday, 27 July, at 7:00 P.M. at the Norview City Community Centre
Manami Ishada, Norview City.
What information about Norview City is mentioned in the interview?

answer.explanation:
Information contained in mayor's dialogue:
“Over the past 25 years, Norview City's population has grown from roughly 20000 to nearly 50000”

question.text: In the letter to the editor, the word "conducted" in paragraph 1, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: This is a vocabulary question. It is necessary to base on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer. The word "conducted" means "conducted and managed". So the answer C is the most suitable.

question.text: What most likely is true about the letter to the editor?
choices: (A)It was written by a business owner.
(B)It was discussed at July's public hearing.
(C)It was read aloud on a radio program.

answer.explanation:
According to the article “Happy days for Norview City Council”, “a poll released on 14 April by the Center for Civic Engagement (CCE) revealed that just 19 percent of the backed the plan” (a vote announced on April 14 by the Citizen Meeting Center (CCE) revealed that only 19% of respondents supported this plan.) In a letter to the editor, the writer also mentioned a waiver votes with the same figures. “A poll conducted last week by the Center for Civic Engagement has shown that 19 percent of approve of the RIR.” (A vote directed by the Citizen Meeting Center last week found 19% of respondents agree with the IRI).
Thus, this person writes a letter 1 week after the April 14 vote, which means that the letter was born in April.

question.text: What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (A)To describe a change in public opinion
(B)To release information about a new community center.
(C)To predict the outcome of a public hearing
(D)To explain the reason for a survey

answer.text: (A)To describe a change in public opinion
answer.explanation: The title of the article is "Happy Days for Norview City Council" and it mentions the results of the new investigation, with an increase in the proportion of participants in favor of the IRI. there. Therefore, it can be said that the purpose of this article is to talk about the change in public opinion.

question.text: What most likely did the city council do to get more support for the IRI?
choices: (A)It improved the quality of government-sponsored program.
(B)It used the media to provide more information to the public.
(C)It reduced the tax rate it had initially proposed.
(D)It contacted more than half of Norview city's residents.

answer.text: (C)It reduced the tax rate it had initially proposed.
answer.explanation:
In the article it says: “the council has held a series of public hearings, and a number of adjustments have been made to the proposal.” (The committee held a series of public hearing sessions, and some modifications were made to the proposal.)
In the original proposal there was an increase in local taxes, which get disapproval. So, for more support, the council may have adjusted this tax.

In addition, information in other options can also be found inaccurate. So the answer is B.

question.text: What presentations by Ms. Singh did Mr. Beaumont attend?

answer.explanation: In the email, Mr. Beaumont said he was impressed by Mrs. Gingh's speech at the Makey School of Business. Compare to the biography on the website, this lecture is called Sustaining imagination

question.text: When did Ms, Singh most likely present at City Business Expo?

answer.explanation: According to the rating card, the speaker who entered the last day's favorite speaker and according to the explanation below it was Ms. Singh. In the email, Mr. Beaumont said that the exhibition took place from 7-10 March. So the last day of the exhibition that Ms. Singh visited was March 10th. <

question.text: What critique did Mr. Kotoa provide?
choices: (A)The registration process took longer than expected.
(C)The venue for the expo was not ideal.
(D)The tips from the speakers were not practical.

answer.text: (C)The venue for the expo was not ideal.
answer.explanation:
Translate:
What criticisms does Mr. Kotoa provide?
(A) The registration process is longer than expected
( B) Limited social opportunities
(C) Not ideal venue for exhibition
(D) Tips from impractical speakers (A) The registration process took longer than expected. (B) The opportunities for networking were limited. (D) The tips from the speakers were not practical.
